messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Being off topic ...
messages.msgSnippet: Thank you, I agree wholeheartedly. Mary ... Just for the record, the Hell and Hitler and Religion and so on threads, where opinons are not masquerading as
messages.messageBody:
Thank you, I agree wholeheartedly.
Mary
Fetteroll wrote:on 8/10/02 12:07 AM, llindsey3@... at llindsey3@... wrote:

> i think that any of these interesting topics oughtta be tolerated because if
> we are unschooling parents.. we must continue with a good example and unschool
> ourselves as we go.. and i find a lot of interesting information on these ot
> posts..

Just for the record, the Hell and Hitler and Religion and so on threads,
where opinons are not masquerading as facts, are all in the realm of Helen's
"we do encourage wandering off that topic [of unschooling]."

So, yes, they're more than tolerated! :-)

Joyce
Unschooling-dotcom moderator

messages.subject: OT? and  2219 Death from Religion
messages.msgSnippet: i think that any of these interesting topics oughtta be tolerated because if we are unschooling parents.. we must continue with a good example and unschool
messages.messageBody:
i think that any of these interesting topics oughtta be tolerated because if we are unschooling parents.. we must continue with a good example and unschool ourselves as we go.. and i find a lot of interesting information on these ot posts..
Linda LL
----- Original Message -----
From: Luz Shosie and Ned Vare
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 09, 2002 7:00 PM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: 2219 Death from Religion


on 8/9/02 2:26 PM, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com at
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:

Julie asks:
> How many people do you figure Christianity has killed? We've got the
> Crusades, Spanish Inquisition, Converting of Celts, Native Americans,
> Africans, etc...

Ned butts in:
Julie, you get my vote.
Recently there have been tallies made about how many people have been killed
by their own governments. I'll try to find the numbers. (Hope this isn't OT,
but no one has objected to this thread yet) The numbers are as astronomical
as the ones for religions killing people, and for racial murdering, or
simple plunder and other reasons. The government killings include, of
course, Gallileo, Socretes, and Jesus. Then there are the 24 Salem
"witches"...

It takes government to make a war.

Does anybody know the penalties for homeschooling a child in the countries
in Europe in which it is prohibited?

In Massachusetts, there is a homeschooling family whose children are under
the jurisdiction of the state dept of something, not for abuse or neglect of
any kind -- it has never been about inadequate parenting -- but for not
submitting a curriculum to the local school district.

Ned Vare
www.borntoexplore.org/unschool
